00058     /// @internal
00059     /// @namespace phys::debug
00060     /// @brief This namespace is for internal debugging tools. In general it should be used in game code.
00061     /// @details This whole debug namespace is a dirty hack. This is where internal only classes and functions go
00062     /// that can and maybe should be ommited from release builds
00063     namespace debug
00064     {
00065         /// @internal
00066         /// @class InternalDebugDrawer
00067         /// @brief This is used to draw wireframse for the Physics subsystem
00068         class InternalDebugDrawer : public btIDebugDraw
00069         {
00070             private:
00071                 /// @internal
00072                 /// @brief A pointer to phys::World that this Debug Drawer works with
00073                 World* ParentWorld;
00074 
00075                 /// @internal
00076                 /// @brief How many wireframes do you want to keep around on the screen.
00077                 Whole WireFrameCount;
00078 
00079                 /// @internal
00080                 /// @brief This queue stores The listing of of the wireframes still to be rendered.
00081                 /// @details This stores an amount of wireframes up to the WireFrameCount. When this class is created or a
00082                 /// new frame rendered a new Line group is a added to this queue.
00083                 std::queue<phys::LineGroup*> WireFrames;
00084 
00085                 /// @internal
00086                 /// @brief This stores whether or not to render physics debug lines
00087                 /// @details This stores whether or not to render physics debud lines. 0 = Do not draw anything. 1 = Draw model wireframes.
00088                 /// Later we will add support for contact drawing, individual modeling drawing, etc...
00089                 int DebugDrawing;
00090             public:
00091                 /// @internal
00092                 /// @brief Basic Constructor
00093                 /// @param ParentWorld_ This is a Pointer to the world to be rendered
00094                 /// @param WireFrameCount_ This sets the amount of previous Wireframes to be rendered, see InternalDebugDrawer::SetWireFrameCount for details.
00095                 /// @details This creates a basic Debug Drawer which works with the phys::World that was passed. With a new
00096                 InternalDebugDrawer(phys::World *ParentWorld_, Whole WireFrameCount_ = 2);
00097 
00098                 /// @internal
00099                 /// @brief Destructor
00100                 /// @details This deletes all the Wireframes and will stop wireframe rendering
00101                 ~InternalDebugDrawer();
00102 
00103                 /// @internal
00104                 /// @brief This will prepare a line segment for being drawn
00105                 /// @details This adds the points for a line to the internal list of points to be rendered.
00106                 /// @param from The first point of the line
00107                 /// @param to The second point of the line
00108                 /// @param color Currently ignored
00109                 virtual void drawLine(const btVector3& from,const btVector3& to,const btVector3& color);
00110 
00111                 /// @internal
00112                 /// @brief This add all the rendering information to the graphics subsystem
00113                 /// @details This sends all the points in the list of lines to the rendering subsystem(currently ogre), where they will stay until deleted
00114                 virtual void PrepareForRendering();
00115 
00116                 /// @internal
00117                 /// @brief Sets the amount of previous wireframes to leave visible.
00118                 /// @details This will limit the amount of previous wireframes drawn. Setting this will cause all the extra wireframes to be deleted
00119                 /// InternalDebugDrawer::PrepareForRendering() is next called, which should happen just before everything is rendered.
00120                 /// @param WireFrameCount_ This is a whole number which is limit.
00121                 virtual void SetWireFrameCount(Whole WireFrameCount_);
00122 
00123                 /// @internal
00124                 /// @brief This returns the amount of wireframes to be drawn
00125                 /// @details This returns either 2 or the amount last set by InternalDebugDrawer::SetWireFrameCount .
00126                 /// @return This returns a whole number with the wireframe limit.
00127                 virtual Whole GetWireFrameCount();
00128 
00129                 /// @internal
00130                 /// @brief Currently Unused
00131                 /// @details Currently Unused
00132                 /// @param PointOnB Currently Unused
00133                 /// @param normalOnB Currently Unused
00134                 /// @param distance Currently Unused
00135                 /// @param lifeTime Currently Unused
00136                 /// @param color Currently Unused
00137                 virtual void drawContactPoint(const btVector3& PointOnB,const btVector3& normalOnB,btScalar distance,int lifeTime,const btVector3& color);
00138 
00139                 /// @internal
00140                 /// @brief Used by the physics subsystem to report errors using the renderer
00141                 /// @details We *Believe* that this is used by the physics subsystem to report errors about rendering to the developer/user. As such, we
00142                 /// Have redirected all input from this function to the World::Log function.
00143                 /// @param warningString We *Believe* These are messagesfrom the physics subsystem, and that this should not directly called otherwise
00144                 virtual void reportErrorWarning(const char* warningString);
00145 
00146                 /// @internal
00147                 /// @brief Currently Unused
00148                 /// @details Currently Unused
00149                 /// @param location Currently Unused
00150                 /// @param textString Currently Unused
00151                 virtual void draw3dText(const btVector3& location, const char* textString);
00152 
00153                 /// @internal
00154                 /// @brief This is used to decide how much the debug render should draw
00155                 /// @details Currently this accepts btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe and setting these will either start or stop
00156                 /// Wireframe rendering. All other btIDebugDraw values are ignored.
00157                 /// @param debugMode An Int which contains either btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe
00158                 virtual void setDebugMode(int debugMode);
00159 
00160                 /// @internal
00161                 /// @brief This will return the current debug mode.
00162                 /// @details Currently this can only return btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe
00163                 /// @return Returns the Current debug mode, currently either btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe
00164                 virtual int getDebugMode() const;
00165         };
00166 
00167         InternalDebugDrawer::InternalDebugDrawer( phys::World *ParentWorld_, Whole WireFrameCount_ )
00168         {
00169             this->DebugDrawing = 0;
00170             this->ParentWorld = ParentWorld_;
00171 
00172             this->WireFrameCount = WireFrameCount_;
00173 
00174             //phys::LineGroup* temp = new phys::LineGroup(this->ParentWorld);
00175             this->WireFrames.push(new phys::LineGroup(this->ParentWorld));
00176         }
00177 
00178         InternalDebugDrawer::~InternalDebugDrawer()
00179         {
00180             while ( ! this->WireFrames.empty() )
00181             {
00182                 delete this->WireFrames.front();
00183                 this->WireFrames.pop();
00184             }
00185         }
00186 
00187         void InternalDebugDrawer::drawLine(const btVector3& from,const btVector3& to,const btVector3& color)
00188         {
00189             phys::LineGroup *myLine = this->WireFrames.back();
00190 
00191             //Convert btVectors to PhysVector3s
00192             Vector3 LineStart(from);
00193             Vector3 LineEnd(to);
00194 
00195             myLine->addPoint(LineStart);
00196             myLine->addPoint(LineEnd);
00197         }

00200         {
00201 
00202         }

00204         void InternalDebugDrawer::reportErrorWarning(const char* warningString)
00205         {
00206             String temp(warningString);
00207             this->ParentWorld->Log(temp);
00208         }
00209 
00210         void InternalDebugDrawer::draw3dText(const btVector3& location,const char* textString)
00211         {}
00212 
00213         void InternalDebugDrawer::setDebugMode(int debugMode)
00214         {
00215             this->DebugDrawing = debugMode;
00216         }
00217 
00218         int InternalDebugDrawer::getDebugMode() const
00219         {
00220             return this->DebugDrawing;
00221         }
00222 
00223         void InternalDebugDrawer::PrepareForRendering()
00224         {
00225             if(!this->WireFrames.empty())
00226             {
00227                 this->WireFrames.back()->drawLines();
00228             }
00229 
00230             //Delete extra wireframes
00231             while ( this->WireFrames.size() > this->WireFrameCount )
00232             {
00233                 delete this->WireFrames.front();
00234                 this->WireFrames.pop();
00235             }
00236 
00237             //This will add the Ogre Scene Nodes to the world and set up a
00238             this->WireFrames.back()->PrepareForRendering();
00239             this->WireFrames.push(new phys::LineGroup(this->ParentWorld));
00240         }
00241 
00242         void InternalDebugDrawer::SetWireFrameCount(Whole WireFrameCount_)
00243         {
00244             this->WireFrameCount = WireFrameCount_;
00245         }
00246 
00247         Whole InternalDebugDrawer::GetWireFrameCount()
00248         {
00249             return this->WireFrameCount;
00250         }

00257     PhysicsManager::PhysicsManager(World* GameWorld_)
00258     {
00259         this->Construct(GameWorld_,Vector3(-10.0,-10.0,-10.0), Vector3(10.0,10.0,10.0), 10);
00260     }

00262     PhysicsManager::PhysicsManager(World* GameWorld_, const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_, const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_, const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00263     {
00264         this->Construct(GameWorld_, GeographyLowerBounds_, GeographyUpperbounds_, MaxPhysicsProxies_);
00265     }

00267     PhysicsManager::~PhysicsManager()
00268     {
00269         //Destroy the physical world that we loved and cherished
00270         delete BulletDynamicsWorld;
00271         delete BulletDispatcher;
00272         delete BulletCollisionConfiguration;
00273         delete BulletSolver;
00274         delete BulletBroadphase;
00275         delete BulletDrawer;
00276 
00277     }
00278 
00279     void PhysicsManager::Construct(World* GameWorld_, const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_, const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_, const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00280     {
00281         this->GameWorld = GameWorld_;
00282 
00283 
00284         //instantiate the Physics engine and related items
00285         //this->PhysicsStepsize = btScalar(1.)/btScalar(60.);
00286 
00287         this->GeographyLowerBounds = GeographyLowerBounds_;
00288         this->GeographyUpperBounds = GeographyUpperbounds_;
00289         this->MaxPhysicsProxies = MaxPhysicsProxies_;
00290 
00291         this->BulletBroadphase = new btAxisSweep3(  GeographyLowerBounds.GetBulletVector3(),
00292                                                     GeographyUpperBounds.GetBulletVector3(),
00293                                                     MaxPhysicsProxies
00294                                                  );
00295 
00296         this->BulletSolver = new btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver;
00297         this->BulletCollisionConfiguration = new btDefaultCollisionConfiguration();
00298         this->BulletDispatcher = new btCollisionDispatcher(BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00299         btGImpactCollisionAlgorithm::registerAlgorithm(BulletDispatcher);
00300 
00301         this->BulletDynamicsWorld = new btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld(
00302                                                     BulletDispatcher,
00303                                                     BulletBroadphase,
00304                                                     BulletSolver,
00305                                                     BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00306 
00307 
00308     }
00309 
00310     void PhysicsManager::Initialize()
00311     {
00312         // This came from the Game init function, and may need to go to a game init.
00313         this->BulletDrawer = new debug::InternalDebugDrawer(this->GameWorld);
00314         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->setDebugDrawer(this->BulletDrawer);
00315 
00316     }

00320     void PhysicsManager::DoMainLoopItems(const Real &TimeElapsed)
00321     {
00322         Real FloatTime = TimeElapsed;
00323         FloatTime *= 0.0001;    //Convert from MilliSeconds to Seconds
00324 
00325         Real IdealStep = this->GameWorld->TargetFrameLength;
00326         IdealStep *= 0.0001;
00327 
00328         //int MaxSteps = (FloatTime<IdealStep) ? 1 : int(FloatTime/IdealStep+1);
00329         int MaxSteps = (FloatTime<IdealStep) ? 1 : int(FloatTime/IdealStep+2);  //used 2 simply to be extra safe
00330         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->stepSimulation( FloatTime, MaxSteps, IdealStep);
00331 
00332         if( this->BulletDrawer->getDebugMode() )        //this part is responsible for drawing the wireframes
00333         {
00334             this->BulletDrawer->PrepareForRendering();
00335             this->BulletDynamicsWorld->debugDrawWorld();
00336         }
00337     }
00338 
00339     void PhysicsManager::SetGravity(Vector3 pgrav)
00340     {
00341         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->setGravity(pgrav.GetBulletVector3());
00342     }

00348     void PhysicsManager::SetDebugPhysicsRendering(int ToBeEnabled)
00349     {
00350         if(ToBeEnabled)
00351         {
00352             this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getDebugDrawer()->setDebugMode(btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe);
00353         }else{
00354             this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getDebugDrawer()->setDebugMode(btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug);
00355         }
00356     }
00357 
00358     int PhysicsManager::GetDebugPhysicsRendering()
00359     {
00360         if(this->BulletDrawer->getDebugMode()==btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe)
00361         {
00362             return 1;
00363         }else{
00364             return 0;
00365         }
00366     }

00368     void PhysicsManager::SetDebugPhysicsWireCount(Whole WireFrameCount_)
00369     {
00370         this->BulletDrawer->SetWireFrameCount(WireFrameCount_);
00371     }
00372 
00373     Whole PhysicsManager::GetDebugPhysicsWireCount()
00374     {
00375         return this->BulletDrawer->GetWireFrameCount();
